nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text: How did this work again? Which one do I press...

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: Dad! Hello? Can you hear me?

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text: Johnny, my boy! Can you hear me alright?

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: Yeah, dad. I can hear you. Can you hear me?

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text: Yes! Yes, it's good to hear you again, Johnny. How are you doing?

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: Good, dad. I'm doing good.

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text:
Look! I got springrolls! I made 'em this morning, so they're damn ugly.  The
cooking ladies on the internet make everything look so easy.

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: It looks really good, dad. You're getting a lot better at it.

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text:
I'm gonna get you to try it once you can get home. I'll keep practicing.  Maybe
one of these days, they'll taste like your mom's.

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: Yeah, that'd be great.

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text: What have you got, Johnny?

choices.speaker: Son
choices.text: As you can see, I just got the usual frozen microwave dinner.

choices.speaker: Son
choices.text: You know, I just got the usual frozen microwave dinner.

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text: That actually doesn't look half bad! You must be pretty busy, eh, Johnny?

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: Yeah, work really tires me out.

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text:
Oh, Johnny. I keep tellin' you that those things aren't good for you. Full  of
plastic and chemicals. You gotta watch your health, or you'll regret it  when
you get to my age.

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: I know, dad. Work just really tires me out.

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text: Well, I'm starving. Let's eat.

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text: Munch munch munch...

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: Munch munch munch...

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: So, what else did you do today? Munch munch munch...

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text:
Munch munch munch... Not a lot. I took a nap and watched some TV.  There's never
anything interesting on anymore. Not things I like, anyway.

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text:
That sounds nice. I think I'll have to do overtime again this weekend. Not
looking forward to that. Munch munch munch...

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text:
They're working you half to death! Munch munch munch... You gotta find a  place
that treats you better, Johnny. I'm telling you, I never worked  overtime like
you do when I was your age.

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: I know, dad. I'm looking. Munch munch munch...

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text: Cheers! Glug glug glug...

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: Cheers! glug glug glug...

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text:
It was good seeing you again, Johnny. Make sure you get home whenever you  can.
Come home soon.

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: I know, dad. It'll take some time, but I'm trying.

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text: I know.

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: Goodnight, dad. I'll see again, same time next week.

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text: Goodnight.

nodes.speaker: Son
nodes.text: (Stands and walks away, tossing his plastic container into the trash.)

nodes.speaker: Dad
nodes.text:
(Looks out the window, then back at the black screen. Stands and shuffles  to
the sink to clean the dishes. He drops a towel and reluctantly picks it  up,
tired, then continues on his way.)
